education.area: in Computer Science, Minor in Biology

highlights: Participant in the Microsoft Summer Mentorship Program at their New York City Office.
Endeavors included shadowing a mentor with their client interaction and learning Microsoft's culture from guest speakers.
The program concluded with a presentation of a Hackathon project emphasizing divisions of labor and practice with technical skills.
Working within the Department of Biological Sciences with Dr. Phillip Barden.

Previous research included analyzing satellite images and studying the patterns of large social insect colonies within geographical snapshots over time. Current research involves studying Transposable Elements using Python and Bash simulations.
Worked intensively with various data analytic tools including but not limited to BioVoxxel, ImageJ/FIJI, R, and Microsoft Excel.
Lab Technician charged with operating computer laboratories throughout the NJIT campus.

Various duties include managing the printers and copiers present at the lab, helping students and faculty with technical problems, and doing up-keep within the laboratory for continued use by the student body.
work.company: NJIT Media and Technology Support Services

projects.name: Satellite Imagery of Insect Structures: Insights into Global Ecological Declines
projects.description: A project dedicated to the continuing research studying global insect decline. This project involved using various data analytic techniques to quantify the change in social insect populations when observed from space. Completed as part of the NJIT Provost Summer Research Program.

projects.name: Chatroom
projects.description: Created a basic chat bot with a theming built around the Adult Swim animated show "Aqua Teen Hunger Force". Designed for NJIT's Design In Software Engineering class. It is not intended for redistribution but instead as a proof of concept.

projects.name: DNA to Protein Converter
projects.description: A simple program translating an open source DNA to protein converter, originally written in Python 3, converted to C++.

awards.summary: Awarded third place at the conclusion of 2019's annual 24 hour HackNJIT event for work on the application ChemPal.
awards.title: HackNJIT 2019 Finalist
